text:
Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
To the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints who are in all Achaia:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort,
speaker: Narrator

text: who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble by the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also abounds through Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we are afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effective in enduring the same sufferings which we also suffer. Or if we are comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our hope for you is steadfast, knowing that as you partake in the sufferings, so also you will partake of the consolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we would not, brothers, have you ignorant of our troubles which came to us in Asia. We were pressured beyond measure, above strength, so that we despaired even of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: We had the sentence of death in ourselves, so that we would not trust in ourselves, but in God who raises the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: He delivered us from so great a death and does deliver us. In Him we trust that He will still deliver us,
speaker: Narrator

text: as you help together by praying for us, so that thanks may be given by many on our behalf for the gift bestowed upon us by means of many persons.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our rejoicing is this: The testimony of our conscience is that we conducted ourselves in the world, and more abundantly toward you, in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we write nothing else to you than what you read or understand. And I trust you will understand even to the end,
speaker: Narrator

text: as you have understood us in part, that we are yours, boasting even as you are ours on the day of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this confidence I planned to come to you before, that you might have a second benefit:
speaker: Narrator

text: to visit you while going to Macedonia, and to come again to you from Macedonia, and then be sent by you on my way to Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, when I was planning this, did I do this lightly? Or the things that I plan, do I plan according to the flesh, so that I would tell you “Yes, yes” and “No, no”?
speaker: Narrator

text: But as God is true, we did not tell you “Yes” and “No.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by Silas, Timothy, and me, was not “Yes” and “No.” In Him it was “Yes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the promises of God in Him are “Yes,” and in Him “Amen,” to the glory of God through us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now He who establishes us with you in Christ and has anointed us is God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who also has sealed us and established the guarantee with the Spirit in our hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover I call God as a witness upon my soul, that it is to spare you that I have not yet gone to Corinth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that we have dominion over your faith, but we are fellow workers for your joy, for by faith you stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I determined this for myself, that I would not come again to you in sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if I make you sorrowful, who then will there be to make me rejoice, but the one whom I have made sorrowful?
speaker: Narrator

text: I wrote concerning this matter to you, so that when I came, I would not be grieved by those in whom I ought to rejoice, having confidence in you all, that my joy is your joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears, not that you should be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have more abundantly for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if anyone has caused grief, he has not grieved me, but to some extent all of you, not to put it too severely.
speaker: Narrator

text: This punishment which was inflicted by many on such a man is sufficient.
speaker: Narrator

text: So on the contrary, you ought to forgive him and comfort him, lest perhaps he might be swallowed up with excessive sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I ask you to confirm your love toward him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to this end I also wrote, so that I might know that you are proving yourselves by whether you are being obedient in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whomever you forgive anything, I also forgive. For if I forgave someone anything, for your sakes I forgave it in Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest Satan should take advantage of us. For we are not ignorant of his devices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christ’s gospel, and a door was opened to me by the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: I had no rest in my spirit, because I did not find Titus my brother. So taking my leave of them, I went from there into Macedonia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now thanks be to God who always causes us to triumph in Christ and through us reveals the fragrance of His knowledge in every place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are to God a sweet fragrance of Christ among those who are saved and among those who perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the one we are the fragrance of death, which brings death, and to the other the fragrance of life, which brings life. Who is sufficient for these things?
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are not as many are who peddle the word of God. Instead, being sent by God, we sincerely speak in Christ in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? Or do we need, as some others, letters of commendation to you, or letters of commendation from you?
speaker: Narrator

text: You are our letter written in our hearts, known and read by all men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are prominently declared to be the letter of Christ, prepared by us, written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on human tablets of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have such trust through Christ toward God,
speaker: Narrator

text: not that we are sufficient in ourselves to take credit for anything of ourselves, but our sufficiency is from God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who has made us able ministers of the new covenant, not of the letter but of the Spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the ministry that brought death, written and engraved on stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not look intently at the face of Moses because of the glory of his countenance, the glory which was to fade away,
speaker: Narrator

text: how will the ministry of the Spirit not be more glorious?
speaker: Narrator

text: For if the ministry of condemnation is glorious, the ministry of righteousness much more exceeds it in glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even that which was made glorious had no glory in comparison to the glory that excels.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if that which fades was glorious, that which remains is much more glorious.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing then that we have such hope, we speak with great boldness,
speaker: Narrator

text: not as Moses, who put a veil over his face, so that the children of Israel could not look intently at the end of what was fading away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, their minds were blinded. For until this day the same veil remains unlifted in the reading of the old covenant, the veil which was done away with in Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But even to this day, when Moses is read, the veil is in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless when anyone turns to the Lord, the veil is removed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord is the Spirit. And where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we all, seeing the glory of the Lord with unveiled faces, as in a mirror, are being transformed into the same image from glory to glory by the Spirit of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, since we have this ministry through the mercy we have received, we do not lose heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we have renounced the secret things of shame, not walking in craftiness nor handling the word of God deceitfully, but by expressing the truth and commending ourselves to every man’s conscience in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if our gospel is hidden, it is hidden to those who are lost.
speaker: Narrator

text: The god of this world has blinded the minds of those who do not believe, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we do not preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord, and ourselves your servants for Jesus’ sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, has shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, the excellency of the power being from God and not from ourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are troubled on every side, yet not distressed; we are perplexed, but not in despair;
speaker: Narrator

text: persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;
speaker: Narrator

text: and always carrying around in the body the death of the Lord Jesus, that also the life of Jesus might be expressed in our bodies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus’ sake, that also the life of Jesus might be manifested in our mortal flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, death works in us, but life in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have the same spirit of faith. As it is written, “I believed, and therefore I have spoken.” So we also believe and therefore speak,
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing that He who raised the Lord Jesus will also raise us through Jesus and will present us with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these things are for your sakes, so that the abundant grace through the thanksgiving of many might overflow to the glory of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason we do not lose heart: Even though our outward man is perishing, yet our inward man is being renewed day by day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our light affliction, which lasts but for a moment, works for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory,
speaker: Narrator

text: while we do not look at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen. For the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that if our earthly house, this tent, were to be destroyed, we have an eternal building of God in the heavens, a house not made with hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this one we groan, earnestly desiring to be sheltered with our house which is from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus being sheltered, we shall not be found unsheltered.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we who are in this tent groan, being burdened, not because we wish to be unclothed, but to be further clothed, so that what is mortal might be swallowed up by life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now He who has created us for this very thing is God, who also has given to us the guarantee of the Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we are always confident, knowing that while we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we walk by faith, not by sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, I say that we are confident and willing to be absent from the body and to be present with the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So whether present or absent, we labor that we may be accepted by Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, that each one may receive his recompense in the body, according to what he has done, whether it was good or bad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, knowing the fear of the Lord, we persuade men. But we are revealed to God, and I trust we are also revealed in your consciences.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are not commending ourselves again to you. Instead, we give you occasion to boast on our behalf, that you may have something to answer those who boast in appearance and not in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we are beside ourselves, it is for God; if we are in our right mind, it is for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the love of Christ constrains us, because we thus judge: that if one died for all, then all have died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He died for all, that those who live should not from now on live for themselves, but for Him who died for them and rose again.
speaker: Narrator

text: So from now on we do not regard anyone according to the flesh. Yes, though we have known Christ according to the flesh, yet we do not regard Him as such from now on.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, if any man is in Christ, he is a new creature. Old things have passed away. Look, all things have become new.
speaker: Narrator

text: All this is from God, who has reconciled us to Himself through Jesus Christ and has given to us the ministry of reconciliation,
speaker: Narrator

text: that is, that God was in Christ reconciling the world to Himself, not counting their sins against them, and has entrusted to us the message of reconciliation.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God were pleading through us. We implore you in Christ’s stead: Be reconciled to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: God made Him who knew no sin to be sin for us, that we might become the righteousness of God in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As workers together with God, we ask you not to receive the grace of God in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He says:
“In an acceptable time I have listened to you,
    and in the day of salvation I have helped you.”
Look, now is the accepted time; look, now is the day of salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: We give no offense in anything, that our service may not be blamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But in all things we commend ourselves as servants of God: in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distress,
speaker: Narrator

text: in stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labors, in sleeplessness, and in hunger;
speaker: Narrator

text: by purity, by knowledge, by patience, by kindness, by the Holy Spirit, by genuine love,
speaker: Narrator

text: by the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,
speaker: Narrator

text: by honor and dishonor, by evil report and good report; as deceivers, and yet true;
speaker: Narrator

text: as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and look, we live; as punished, but not killed;
speaker: Narrator

text: as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; and as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Corinthians, we have spoken frankly to you; our heart is opened wide.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not restrained by us, but you are restrained in your own affections.
speaker: Narrator

text: In return (I speak as to my children) you also be open.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be unequally yoked together with unbelievers. For what fellowship has righteousness with unrighteousness? What communion has light with darkness?
speaker: Narrator

text: What agreement has Christ with Belial? Or what part has he who believes with an unbeliever?
speaker: Narrator

text:
What agreement has the temple of God with idols? For you are the temple of the living God. As God has said:
“I will live in them
    and walk in them.
I will be their God,
    and they shall be My people.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore,
“Come out from among them
    and be separate,
        says the Lord.
Do not touch what is unclean,
    and I will receive you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I will be a Father to you,
    and you shall be My sons and daughters,
        says the Lord Almighty.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Since we have these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Accept us. We have wronged no one, we have corrupted no one, and we have defrauded no one.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not say this to condemn you, for I have said before that you are in our hearts, so that we would die or live with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is my boldness of speech toward you; great is my boasting of you. I am filled with comfort, and I am exceedingly joyful in all our tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when we came to Macedonia, our bodies had no rest, and we were troubled on every side. On the outside were conflicts; on the inside were fears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless God, who comforts the downcast, comforted us through the coming of Titus,
speaker: Narrator

text: and not only by his coming, but also by the comfort with which he was comforted in you, when he told us about your sincere desire, your mourning, and your zeal toward me, so that I rejoiced even more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though I caused you sorrow by my letter, I do not regret it, though I did regret it. For I perceive that this same letter has caused you sorrow, though only for a while.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I rejoice, not that you were made sorrowful, but that your sorrow led to repentance. For you were made sorrowful in a godly way, that you might not suffer loss in any way through us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Godly sorrow produces repentance that leads to salvation and brings no regret, but the sorrow of the world produces death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For observe this very thing, which you sorrowed in a godly way: What carefulness it produced in you, what vindication of yourselves, what indignation, what fear, what intense desire, what zeal, what avenging of wrong! In all things you have proven yourselves to be innocent in this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: So though I wrote to you, I did it not because of him who had done the wrong, nor because of him who suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might be evident to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore we were comforted in your comfort.
Yes, and we were exceedingly the more joyful for the sake of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I am not ashamed if I have boasted of anything to him regarding you. But as we spoke all things to you in truth, even our boasting in the presence of Titus is found to be true.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now his affection abounds all the more toward you, as he remembers the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling you received him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I rejoice that I have confidence in you in everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, brothers, we want you to experience the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia,
speaker: Narrator

text: how in a great trial of affliction, the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty overflowed toward the riches of their generous giving.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I bear record that according to their means, and beyond their means, they freely gave,
speaker: Narrator

text: begging us with much urgency that we would receive the gift and the fellowship of ministering to the saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: This they did, not as we expected. First, they gave themselves to the Lord, and then to us by the will of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we urged Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also complete this gracious deed for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as you abound in everything—in faith, in utterance, in knowledge, in all diligence, and in your love to us—see that you abound in this grace also.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say this not as a command, but to prove through the authenticity of others, the sincerity also of your love.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though He was rich, yet for your sakes He became poor, that through His poverty you might be rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in this matter I give my advice. It is appropriate for you, who began last year not only to give, but also to willingly give.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore complete the task, so that, as there was a willingness to do so, there may be a performance of it according to your means.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if there is a willing mind first, the gift is accepted according to what a man possesses and not according to what he does not possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not mean that other men have relief, and you be burdened,
speaker: Narrator

text: but for equality, that your abundance now at this time may supply their need, and their abundance may supply your need—that there may be equality.
speaker: Narrator

text: As it is written, “He who gathered much had no excess. And he who gathered little had no lack.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But thanks be to God, who placed the same sincere care in the heart of Titus for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For indeed he accepted the exhortation. But being more zealous, he went to you of his own accord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we have sent with him the brother whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches.
speaker: Narrator

text: And not only that, but he was also chosen by the churches to travel with us with this gift, which we administer to the glory of the same Lord, and to declare your willing mind,
speaker: Narrator

text: to prevent any man from blaming us in administering this abundant gift,
speaker: Narrator

text: providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord but also in the sight of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, we have sent with them our brother whom we have frequently proved diligent in many things, but now is much more diligent, due to the great confidence which he has in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone inquires about Titus, he is my partner and fellow helper concerning you. Or if our brothers are inquired about, they are the messengers of the churches, and the glory of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore show to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love and of our boasting on your behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is redundant for me to write to you concerning the ministry to the saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know your willingness, for which I boast of you to those in Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago, and your zeal has stirred up most of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I have sent the brothers, lest our boasting of you might be in vain in this case, that, as I said, you may be ready;
speaker: Narrator

text: and lest if any Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, we (not to mention you) should be ashamed of this confident boasting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brothers to go ahead to you and arrange beforehand your bountiful gift you previously promised, that it might be prepared as a gift, not as a matter of greed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this I say: He who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and he who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let every man give according to the purposes in his heart, not grudgingly or out of necessity, for God loves a cheerful giver.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is able to make all grace abound toward you, so that you, always having enough of everything, may abound to every good work.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Now He who supplies seed to the sower and supplies bread for your food will also multiply your seed sown and increase the fruits of your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you will be enriched in everything to all bountifulness, which makes us give thanks to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the administration of this service not only supplies the need of the saints, but is abundant also through many thanksgivings to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, through the performance of this ministry, they glorify God for the profession of your faith in the gospel of Christ and for your liberal sharing with them and with all others.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in their prayer for you, they long for you because of the surpassing grace of God in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I, Paul, who am lowly in presence among you but bold toward you while absent, appeal to you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: I beg you that when I am present, I might not have to be bold with that confidence by which I intend to be bold against some, who think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war according to the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strongholds,
speaker: Narrator

text: casting down imaginations and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God, bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: and being ready to punish all disobedience when your obedience is complete.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you look at things from the outward appearance? If any man trusts that he is Christ’s, let him consider again that, as he is Christ’s, even so are we Christ’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: For even if I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord has given us for edification and not for your destruction, I shall not be ashamed,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest I appear to frighten you by my letters.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For his letters,” they say, “are weighty and powerful, but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Let such a person consider this: that as we are in word by letters when we are absent, we will also be in deed when we are present.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we dare not count or compare ourselves with those who commend themselves. They who measure themselves by one another and compare themselves with one another are not wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we will not boast beyond measure, but within the boundaries which God has appointed us, which reach even you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are not overextending ourselves as though we did not reach you, since we have come to you, preaching the gospel of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are not boasting of things beyond our measure in other men’s labors. But we have hope that when your faith is increased, our region shall be greatly enlarged by you,
speaker: Narrator

text: to preach the gospel in the regions beyond you and not to boast in another man’s accomplishments.
speaker: Narrator

text: But, “Let him who boasts, boast in the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is not he who commends himself who is approved, but he whom the Lord commends.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would to God you could bear with me a little in my folly. Indeed, bear with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy. For I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I fear that somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve through his trickery, so your minds might be led astray from the simplicity that is in Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if he who comes preaches another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or if you receive another spirit, which you have not received, or another gospel, which you have not accepted, you might submit to it readily enough.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I think I am not in any way inferior to the most eminent of the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even though I am unpolished in speech, yet I am not in knowledge. All things about us have been thoroughly revealed to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did I commit a sin in abasing myself that you might be exalted, because I preached to you the gospel of God free of charge?
speaker: Narrator

text: I robbed other churches by accepting wages from them to serve you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, when I was present with you and was lacking, I was a burden to no one. For the brothers who came from Macedonia supplied what I lacked. In all things I have kept myself from being burdensome to you, and so will I keep myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the truth of Christ is in me, no one shall stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why? Because I do not love you? God knows.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will continue doing what I am doing, that I may cut off the opportunity from those who desire an opportunity to be found equal to us in what they boast about.
speaker: Narrator

text: For such are false apostles and deceitful workers, disguising themselves as apostles of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no wonder! For even Satan disguises himself as an angel of light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also disguise themselves as ministers of righteousness, whose end will be according to their works.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say again, let no one think that I am a fool. Otherwise, at least receive me as a fool, so that I also may boast a little.
speaker: Narrator

text: What I speak, I speak not according to the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing that many boast according to the flesh, I also will boast.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you tolerate fools gladly, seeing you yourselves are wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you permit it if a man brings you into bondage, if a man devours you, if a man takes from you, if a man exalts himself, or if a man strikes you on the face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I say to my reproach that we were too weak for that.
But whenever anyone is bold (I speak foolishly), I am bold also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? So am I.
speaker: Narrator

text: Are they servants of Christ? I speak as a fool. I am more: in labors more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequently, in deaths often.
speaker: Narrator

text: Five times I received from the Jews forty lashes minus one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times I was beaten with rods; once I was stoned; three times I suffered shipwreck; a night and a day I have been in the deep;
speaker: Narrator

text: in journeys often, in perils of waters, in perils of robbers, in perils by my own countrymen, in perils by the Gentiles, in perils in the city, in perils in the wilderness, in perils in the sea, in perils among false brothers;
speaker: Narrator

text: in weariness and painfulness, in sleeplessness often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, and in cold and nakedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beside the external things, the care of all the churches pressures me daily.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is led into sin, and I am not distressed?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I must boast, I will boast of the things which concern my weakness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed forevermore, knows that I am not lying.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Damascus the governor under King Aretas secured the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desiring to arrest me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I was let down by the wall through a window in a basket and escaped his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doubtless it is not profitable for me to boast. So I will move on to visions and revelations of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I knew a man in Christ over fourteen years ago—whether in the body or out of the body I cannot tell, God knows—such a one was caught up to the third heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I knew that such a man—whether in the body or out of the body I cannot tell, God knows—
speaker: Narrator

text: was caught up into paradise and heard inexpressible words not permitted for a man to say.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of such a person, I will boast. Yet of myself I will not boast, except in my weaknesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if I desire to boast, I will not be a fool, for I will be speaking the truth. But now I resist, lest anyone should think of me above that which he sees me to be or hears from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lest I should be exalted above measure by the abundance of revelations, a thorn was given me in the flesh, a messenger of Satan, to torment me, lest I be exalted above measure.
speaker: Narrator

text: I asked the Lord three times that this thing might depart from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for My strength is made perfect in weakness.” Therefore most gladly I will boast in my weaknesses, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I take pleasure in weaknesses, in reproaches, in hardships, in persecutions, and in distresses for Christ’s sake. For when I am weak, then I am strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have become a fool in boasting. You have compelled me, for I ought to have been commended by you, for I am in no way inferior to the leading apostles, though I am nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly the signs of an apostle were performed among you in all patience, in signs and wonders, and mighty deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in what respect were you inferior to other churches, unless it be that I myself was not burdensome to you? Forgive me this wrong!
speaker: Narrator

text: I am ready to come to you this third time. And I will not be burdensome to you, for I do not seek what is yours, but you. For the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you. If I love you more, am I to be loved less?
speaker: Narrator

text: But be that as it may. I did not burden you. Nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did I take advantage of you by any of those whom I sent to you?
speaker: Narrator

text: I urged Titus to go, and with him I sent a brother. Did Titus take advantage of you? Did we not walk in the same spirit? Did we not walk in the same steps?
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, do you think that we are defending ourselves to you? We speak before God in Christ. We do all things, beloved, for your edifying.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I fear that when I come, I shall not find you such as I wish, and that I shall be found by you such as you do not wish. I fear there are debates, envying, wrath, strife, backbiting, whispering, arrogance, and disorder.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I fear that when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I shall mourn for many who have sinned already, who have not repented of uncleanness, sexual immorality, and lasciviousness which they have committed.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the third time I am coming to you. “In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I told you before, and foretell as if I were present the second time. And being absent now, I write to those who have sinned before, and to all the others, that if I come again, I will not spare anyone,
speaker: Narrator

text: since you seek proof of Christ speaking through me, who toward you is not weak, but is mighty in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For though He was crucified through weakness, yet He lives by the power of God. So also we are weak in Him, but we shall live with Him by the power of God serving you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Examine yourselves, seeing whether you are in the faith; test yourselves. Do you not know that Jesus Christ is in you?—unless indeed you are disqualified.
speaker: Narrator

text: I trust that you will know that we are not disqualified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I pray to God that you do no evil, not that we should appear approved, but that you should do that which is honorable, whether or not we may seem disqualified.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we can do nothing against the truth, but only for the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are glad when we are weak, and you are strong. We wish even your perfection.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should be sharp, according to the authority which the Lord has given me for edification and not for destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, brothers, farewell. Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, and live in peace, and the God of love and peace will be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet one another with a holy kiss.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the saints greet you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
